sentence.Network_en: Many doctors fail to report cases, even though food poisoning is a notifiable disease.
sentence.Network_cn: 很多医生没有报告病例，尽管食物中毒是应该通报的。

sentence.Network_en: Typhoid is an example of a notifiable disease.
sentence.Network_cn: 伤寒是必须报告卫生当局的病例.

sentence.Network_en: Abandoning a child under two years old is a notifiable offence.
sentence.Network_cn: 遗弃两岁以下儿童是一种严重的犯罪行为.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 2010年10月26日 - 猪瘟被世界动物卫生组(OIE)列入OIE疾病名录(OIE Listed diseases),为须申报的(Notifiable)动物传染病,我国也将其列为一类传染病。 据Dune(1975)报道.

entry.tran: (疾病、罪行等)须报告当局的，应向官方汇报的
entry.def: A notifiable disease or crime is one that must be reported to the authorities whenever it occurs, because it is considered to be dangerous to the community.

example.ex: Many doctors fail to report cases, even though food poisoning is a notifiable disease.
example.tran: 很多医生没有报告病例，尽管食物中毒是应该通报的。

means.word_mean: 1. requiring that official notification be given;

auth_sentence.content: Making AIDS...a notifiable disease...would provide powers to detain patients in hospital for treatment.

auth_sentence.content: Other notifiable offences - includes fraud and forgery, blackmail, drug offences, and dangerous driving.
